snippet: Seven months after the election of President Nicolás Maduro, Hugo Chávez’s handpicked heir, inflation and shortages are creating discontent.
abstract: Nicolas Maduro, Venezuela's new president and Hugo Chavez's handpicked heir, has come under withering criticism months after the election for his gaffes and perceived inability to handle country's growing inflation and shortages; many former Chavez supporters find Maduro's attempts to imitate his much-loved mentor unconvincing.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz, Paula Ramón and Catalina Lobo-Guerrero contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Seven months after the election of President Nicolás Maduro, Hugo Chávez’s handpicked heir, inflation and shortages are creating discontent.

headline.main: To Venezuelans, Heir of Chávez Is a Poor Copy
headline.print_headline: To Venezuelans, Heir of Chávez Is a Poor Copy
